definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: Obedience is the aim of supporting parents. No why and no reason to speak of.
sentences.chinese: 養親旨在順意，不問爲什麼，也不能講什麼大道理。

sentences.english: The hollower you big talk is, the more disgusted they feel.
sentences.chinese: 你越講空洞的大道理，人家越感到討厭。

sentences.english: We have to listen to a long sermon about not wasting money.
sentences.chinese: 我們硬着頭皮聽了一通不要浪費錢的大道理。

sentences.english: Minor principles should be subordinated to major ones.
This is my father and I said a major principles.
sentences.chinese: 這是我父親和我說的一個大道理。

sentences.english: Rules to regulate the small shop to obey the major principles of social stability.
sentences.chinese: 規範網店的小道理要服從社會穩定的大道理。

sentences.english: We must have a clear understanding of both major and minor principles.
sentences.chinese: 大道理與小道理必須弄清楚。

sentences.english: Around the thought, the reason is the so-called teaching.
sentences.chinese: 繞有所思，那些大道理是所謂教書育人的架子。

sentences.english: I said, are great truths do not know if there is somewhat applicable to you.
sentences.chinese: 我說的都是大道理，不知道有幾分適用於你。

definition: present the facts and reason things out
pinyin: bai3 shi4 shi2 jiang3 dao4 li3

definition: friendly advice/words spoken on sb's behalf/a good word/kind words/words that sound fine but are not followed up with actions
polite phrase/conventional greetings/cliché/to try to worm facts out of sb
earnest and well-meaning advice (idiom); to persuade patiently
worldly wisdom/the ways of the world/to know how to get on in the world
lit. to quote the classics/to quote chapter and verse (idiom)
